This section presents answers to frequently asked questions
I don't know how to use the trading platform. What should I do?
On our website there is a section with video lessons to familiarize yourself with the basic principles of trading and the functionality of the platform
How do I open an account on the platform?
Go through a simple registration procedure, confirm your account by email and you will be provided with an account automatically
What trading instruments are available for trading?
We provide access to more than 200 trading instruments, which you can familiarize yourself with in a special section
What if I don't have the opportunity to invest large sums?
Many trading instruments do not require large investments, and our platform also provides the opportunity to apply for leverage
Which tariff is right for me?
Each tariff is designed for different categories of users, study the information about the tariffs in the corresponding section and select the appropriate one
What is a broker's account and how does it work?
A broker's account allows you to buy and sell securities, currency or other investment instruments on the stock exchange
Margin lending reduces the need for free cash - you apply for leverage and can make transactions for larger amounts than those that you own
What is margin trading used for?
The use of margin lending allows you to increase profits both when the market is growing and when the market is falling
This is a warning about the lack of funds on the account, for further retention of open positions on the market
Is it possible to submit applications at night?
Yes, you have such an opportunity, since our platform is available for trading 24 hours a day
Is it possible to use analytical instruments on your platform?
This must be done to carry out profitable transactions, our platform offers a wide range of graphical, technical, fundamental, factor analysis
How many tariffs do you offer?
Our platform offers three categories of tariffs for various investment purposes and the size of the initial capital
Where do you get data about quotes from?
We publish data from official sources - large international financial companies
Is there a chance of slippage?
Our servers provide instant execution of orders and minimal probability of price slippage
Who regulates the activities of your company?
Reputable international financial regulators, a list of which you can study in a specialized department
This is an investment strategy in which a trader acquires various categories of assets in an investment portfolio
With the proper use of analytical instruments presented on our platform, investment risks are minimal
What if I have a question about trading at a later time of the day?
Our support team works to solve any of your problems 24 hours a day
I may not understand how to trade on the platform?
Our interface is accessible and intuitive for any user, we also have training videos and a support service
This is a very useful instrument, especially for novice traders, which allows you to calculate the commission on a transaction and the amount of available funds for its completion
I don't understand the difference between stocks and stock indices, what should I do?
Study the description of the markets in the relevant section: the main difference is that indices are a set of stocks of different companies united by a certain attribute
These are contracts that give you the right to own a certain amount of an asset, but do not imply its physical delivery
Why are some markets available in a limited amount of time?
Because different trading platforms are regulated by different countries and global financial organizations in different time zones
To conduct a graphical analysis of a trading instrument and the feasibility of investing in it
Will I be able to make money on trading?
Our users earn millions in total, of course you will succeed, you just need to understand the basic concepts
How to choose from such a large number of trading instruments?
It's very simple: access to trading instruments differs in different tariffs, depending on your experience
Which trading instruments are the easiest to invest in?
There are no easy ones, but the most accessible for novice investors are currencies and stock indices
Why are metals used for long-term investment?
First of all, they do not deteriorate under the influence of environmental factors and are durable, so their prices have a stable positive growth
How does seasonality affect the commodity market?
The production of various categories of assets directly depends on weather conditions, which is why factor analysis of the commodity market is so important
Why are currencies divided into basic and exotic?
Major currencies are the currencies of large countries relative to each other, and exotic ones are the currencies of small countries relative to major currencies or each other

Familiarize yourself with the basic trading concepts
This section provides information about the following definitions: Leverage, Lot Volume, Margin Call, Spread, and so on
A useful instrument when planning transactions

Instrument:
specify the selected financial instrument from the list

Price:
specify the estimated price of opening and closing the order to see the possible result

Trade volume:
specify exact trade volume in lots

Spread in points:
calculated automatically based on the difference between Ask and Bid prices

Margin:
the specified data is the minimum amount of free deposit required to make a transaction

Profit:
indication of probable profit based on current parameters
